availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Clelland Jackson (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer and deputy sheriff)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer and deputy sheriff. Son of Thomas Jackson and Nancy R. Jackson. Married to Elisa Jane Green Jackson in Marion County, Kentucky, on October 25, 1864. Father of Ann G. Jackson. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Farmer in Marion County in 1863. Deputy sheriff in Marion County in 1864.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 602.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 91A.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994047, Marion County Marriages, p. 162.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Marion County, KY 1863, p. 260.
